description: Add Projects management panel to existing Settings page and refactor Scanner page to consume projects from ProjectsContext instead of managing its own project paths. The Settings page currently only has ThemePanel - we need to add ProjectsPanel alongside it for centralized project management.
goal: Centralize project management in Settings page as the single source of truth. Scanner becomes a consumer of projects (read-only with checkboxes) rather than managing its own paths. Eliminate duplicate project management UI across the dashboard.
requirements: Add ProjectsPanel component to Settings page alongside existing ThemePanel
Create project card UI components with add/remove/restore functionality
Remove Scanner's Add Path tool and custom path management
Add checkbox list to Scanner using useProjects() hook
Add 'Manage projects in Settings' link to Scanner
Handle stale project detection and restoration UI
Project cards show: name, path, added date, status (active/stale)
out_of_scope: Creating new global header/sidebar project selectors
Modifying ProjectsContext implementation (already exists and works)
Adding tab navigation to Settings (just add panel)
Changing how ProjectSelector works in CodeRef Explorer (keep as-is)
Multi-project scanning logic (Scanner already has this)
constraints: Settings page already exists at packages/dashboard/src/app/settings/page.tsx with ThemePanel
ProjectsContext already provides addProject(), removeProject(), loadProjects() methods
Scanner should become read-only consumer - no project management
Use existing ProjectSelector component as reference (packages/dashboard/src/components/ProjectSelector/)
Follow existing design system (Tailwind with ind-* tokens)
